data.headline: January CPI came in cooler than expected at 0.2% m/m and 2.4% y/y, with core inflation near four-year lows around 2.5%
bullets: Disinflation trend pulled Treasury yields lower and increased odds of Fed rate cuts
Rotation out of AI-driven mega-cap tech into small caps and value stocks, with the Russell 2000 up about 1.25%
S&P 500 and Dow finished roughly flat while the Nasdaq slipped 0.27%
Tariff-exposed metals and steel stocks lagged the market
Applied Materials surged on strong earnings results
Rivian jumped on continued EV momentum
DraftKings and Pinterest fell after issuing cautious guidance
Major indices still face weekly losses amid tech-led volatility despite benign inflation data
